__init__(AB, contain_pyrex=True, refresh_from_inventor_readings=False)¶

Construct a neutron wall, A or B.

A neutron wall is a collection of bars, self.bars.

Parameters

  • AB ('A' or 'B') – The wall to construct. Currently only ‘B’ is actively maintained and tested.

  • contain_pyrex (bool, default True) – Whether the bars contain pyrex.

  • refresh_from_inventor_readings (bool, default False) – If True, the geometry will be loaded from the inventor readings; if False, the geometry will be loaded from the existing database, stored in *.dat files.

AB¶

Neutron wall name in uppercase.

Type

‘A’ or ‘B’

ab¶

Neutron wall name in lowercase.

Type

‘a’ or ‘b’

database_dir¶

PROJECT_DIR / 'database/neutron_wall/geometry'

Type

pathlib.Path

self.database_dir / f'inventor_readings_NW{self.AB}.txt'

self.database_dir / f'NW{self.AB}_vertices.dat'

path_pca¶

self.database_dir / f'NW{self.AB}_pca.dat'

Type

pathlib.Path

database¶

Dataframe of vertices from all bars

Type

pandas.DataFrame

bars¶

A collection of Bar objects.

The bottommost is bar 0, the topmost is bar 24. In the experiment, bar 0 was not used because it was shadowed.

Type

dict[int, Bar]

static read_from_inventor_readings(filepath)¶

Reads in Inventor measurements and returns Bar objects.

Parameters

filepath (str or pathlib.Path) – The path to the file containing the Inventor measurements, e.g. self.path_inventor_readings.

Returns

bars – A list of Bar objects, sorted from bottom to top.

Return type

list

static save_vertices_to_database(AB, filepath, bars)¶

Saves the vertices of the bars to database.

Parameters

  • AB ('A' or 'B') – Neutron wall A or B.

  • filepath (str or pathlib.Path) – Path to the database file, e.g. self.path_vertices.

  • bars (list of Bar objects) – Sorted from bottom to top. The bottommost bar will be numbered 0; the topmost bar will be numbered 24.

static save_pca_to_database(AB, filepath, bars)¶

Save the principal components of the bars to database.

Parameters

  • AB (str) – Neutron wall A or B.

  • filepath (str or pathlib.Path) – Path to the database file, e.g. self.path_pca.

  • bars (list of Bar objects) – Sorted from bottom to top. The bottommost bar will be numbered 0; the topmost bar will be numbered 24.

get_geometry_efficiency(shadowed_bars, cut_edges_bars='all', skip_bars=(0,), custom_cuts: Optional[Dict[int, List[str]]] = None, norm=True)¶
Parameters

  • shadowed_bars (bool or list of int) – If True, shadow bar cut will be applied to NWB bars 7, 8, 9, 15, 16, 17. If False, no shadow bar cut is applied. If a list of int, shadow bar cut will only be applied to the bars in the list.

  • cut_edges_bars ('all' or list of int, default ‘all’) – If 'all', edge cut will be applied to all bars. If a list of int, edge cut will only be applied to the bars in the list.

  • skip_bars (list of int, default (0, )) – Bars to be skipped. In the experiment, NWB-bar00 is the bottommost bar that was blocked by the ground.

  • custom_cuts (dict of int to list of str, default None) – When custom cuts are applied, all the other cuts are ignored, so users should make sure the cuts are complete, e.g. edge cut is included. The only cut variable being supported is 'x'.

  • norm (bool, default True) – Whether to normalize the efficiency by \(2\pi\).
